description: From Middle English tretable, from treten (“treat”) and Old French traitable, Anglo-Norman tretable; equivalent to treat +‎ -able.

adjectives.description: treatable (comparative more treatable, superlative most treatable)

entries.meaning: Able to be treated; not incurable.
examples: In the 1980s, AIDS was not a treatable disease, and as a consequence the mortality rate at that time was very high.
